text: <@UM1PPQS2V>: In case it helps, I found where you can create partials.  I'm thinking for your case, you could put your social media module and search module in a partial and then style your partial?  You would need to include your modules as a snippet (e.g. {% module "module_15695960690254" path="/custom/Modules/social-module", label="Social Module" no_wrapper="true" %}

Hello everyone. I was going through this article about using the "wrapping HTML" section in the inspector. I am quite confused as to how to exactly use it, as in, if i want wrap a particular grouped module within a div element, where do i get the HUBL token for that particular module from ?
